entries.title: In the Ozone (Wednesday Crossword, June 5)
Wells Fargo Ex-CFO John Shrewsberry Readies GoodLeap for Next Growth Phase
entries.description: The longtime bank executive joined the venture-backed solar financing company as CFO last year. He discusses what he brings to the process of scaling a fintech unicorn.

entries.title: U.S. Prosecutors Probe Global Hacking-for-Hire Operation
entries.description: U.S. prosecutors are seeking to extradite an Israeli private investigator from London as part of a probe into an alleged globe-spanning hacking-for-hire operation that targeted opponents of Elliott Management and Exxon Mobil.

entries.title: Bank of England Can Eye Rate Cuts as Grocery Bills Ease
entries.description: Consumers in the U.K. have increasingly more cash in their pockets, which should induce the Bank of England to begin cutting interest rates, Shore Capital analyst Clive Black writes in a note.

entries.title: Biden Issues Executive Actions on Immigration: What to Know
entries.description: Presidential proclamation meant to restrict asylum as voters say immigration is a top concern in the election.

entries.title: Biden's Cease-Fire Plan Seeks to Push Hamas and Israel Into a Deal Neither Wants
entries.description: The U.S. president is more interested in a deal than the two warring parties.

entries.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Give Back Gains
entries.description: U.S. natural gas futures reversed course in a volatile session and gave back ground made the previous session.

entries.title: Modi Loses Majority in Stunning Election Setback, But Is Set to Keep Power in India
entries.description: The Indian prime minister and his Hindu nationalist party failed to win an outright majority amid a revived opposition.

entries.title: Dollar Weakens in Tandem With Bond Yields
entries.description: The greenback gave up its morning strength amid a decline in U.S. Treasury yields and increasing odds of interest rate cuts by the Fed this summer.

entries.title: This Lavish Bel-Air Mansion Became Their 'Passion Project.' Now They're Listing It for $115 Million.
entries.description: Diana Derycz-Kessler and Paul L. Kessler incorporated hearts throughout the property, which has its own private chapel.

entries.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
entries.description: Gold settled 0.9% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 3.8%, down three of the past four sessions.

entries.title: Aon Poaches Broadridge Finance Chief Edmund Reese
entries.description: Professional-services company Aon has hired Edmund Reese as its next chief financial officer, plucking the executive from Broadridge Financial Solutions.

entries.title: The Baseball Player Who Bet $99---and Cost Himself $740,000
entries.description: Michael Kelly was a minor-league pitcher when he wagered less than a hundred bucks on baseball. Now a reliever for the Oakland A’s, he has received a year-long suspension and will forfeit his annual salary.

entries.title: Frontdoor to Buy 2-10 Home Buyers Warranty in $585 Million Deal
entries.description: The company said the deal adds a new business line that complements its existing home-warranty customer base.

entries.title: Garland Hearing Devolves Into Partisan Brawl
entries.description: The attorney general says “I will not be intimidated” as he faces a potential contempt vote in Congress.

entries.title: Hunter Biden's 'Choice to Buy a Gun Is Why We're Here,' Prosecutor Says
entries.description: Declaring ‘no one is above the law,’ a federal prosecutor kicked off the Justice Department’s case against the president’s son on gun charges.

entries.title: Menendez Brings Displeasure to Democrats
entries.description: Holding the Senate majority was already a heavy lift in 2024.

entries.title: An Election Rebuke for India's Narendra Modi
entries.description: The country’s voters want economic results more than ethnic chauvinism.

entries.title: Volvo Says Users Can Track Source of Battery Metals in Its EVs
entries.description: A supply-chain tracker created in partnership with British technology firm Circulor will show the origin of raw materials such as cobalt, lithium and nickel.

entries.title: Correction
entries.description: ‘The Art Book for Children’ includes introductions to the works of Edgar Degas and Jan van Eyck.
